school_management module

School Management System Core Module

This module provides the core classes for managing a school system including students, instructors, courses, and the overall school management system. It includes comprehensive validation, data persistence, and relationship management.

class school_management.Course(course_id: str, course_name: str, instructor=None)[source]

Bases: object

Class representing a course in the school management system.

Manages course information, instructor assignment, and student enrollment. Provides validation for course data and maintains bidirectional relationships with instructors and students.

Parameters:

  • course_id (str) – Unique identifier for the course

  • course_name (str) – The name/title of the course

  • instructor (Instructor, optional) – The instructor assigned to teach this course, defaults to None

Raises:

ValueError – If course_id or course_name fail validation

Variables:

  • course_id (str) – The course’s unique identifier

  • course_name (str) – The course’s name

  • instructor (Instructor or None) – The assigned instructor

  • enrolled_students (List[Student]) – List of students enrolled in the course

add_student(student)[source]

Add a student to the course enrollment.

Adds the student to the enrolled students list. Prevents duplicate enrollments.

Parameters:

student (Student) – The student to enroll

to_dict()[source]

Convert course object to dictionary representation.

Creates a dictionary containing all course data including instructor ID and enrolled student IDs for serialization purposes.

Returns:

Dictionary representation of the course

Return type:

dict

class school_management.Instructor(name: str, age: int, email: str, instructor_id: str)[source]

Bases: Person

Class representing an instructor in the school management system.

Extends the Person class to include instructor-specific functionality such as instructor ID management and course assignment tracking.

Parameters:

  • name (str) – The instructor’s full name

  • age (int) – The instructor’s age in years

  • email (str) – The instructor’s email address

  • instructor_id (str) – Unique identifier for the instructor

Raises:

ValueError – If any parameter fails validation

Variables:

  • instructor_id (str) – The instructor’s unique identifier

  • assigned_courses (List[Course]) – List of courses assigned to the instructor

assign_course(course)[source]

Assign a course to the instructor.

Adds the course to the instructor’s assigned courses list and sets the instructor as the course’s instructor. Prevents duplicate assignments.

Parameters:

course (Course) – The course to assign

to_dict()[source]

Convert instructor object to dictionary representation.

Creates a dictionary containing all instructor data including assigned course IDs for serialization purposes.

Returns:

Dictionary representation of the instructor

Return type:

dict

class school_management.Person(name: str, age: int, email: str)[source]

Bases: object

Base class representing a person in the school management system.

This abstract base class provides common functionality for all person types in the system, including name, age, and email management with validation.

Parameters:

  • name (str) – The person’s full name

  • age (int) – The person’s age in years

  • email (str) – The person’s email address

Raises:

ValueError – If any parameter fails validation

get_email()[source]

Get the person’s email address.

Returns:

The person’s email address

Return type:

str

introduce()[source]

Print a formatted introduction message for the person.

Outputs a standardized greeting including the person’s name and age. This method is primarily used for testing and demonstration purposes.

set_email(email: str)[source]

Set a new email address for the person.

Parameters:

email (str) – The new email address

Raises:

ValueError – If the email format is invalid

class school_management.SchoolManagementSystem[source]

Bases: object

Main class for managing the school management system.

Provides centralized management of students, instructors, and courses. Handles data persistence, search functionality, and maintains system integrity.

Variables:

  • students (List[Student]) – List of all students in the system

  • instructors (List[Instructor]) – List of all instructors in the system

  • courses (List[Course]) – List of all courses in the system

add_course(course: Course)[source]

Add a course to the school management system.

Parameters:

course (Course) – The course to add to the system

add_instructor(instructor: Instructor)[source]

Add an instructor to the school management system.

Parameters:

instructor (Instructor) – The instructor to add to the system

add_student(student: Student)[source]

Add a student to the school management system.

Parameters:

student (Student) – The student to add to the system

find_course_by_id(course_id: str)[source]

Find a course by its unique course ID.

Parameters:

course_id (str) – The course ID to search for

Returns:

The course object if found, None otherwise

Return type:

Course or None

find_instructor_by_id(instructor_id: str)[source]

Find an instructor by their unique instructor ID.

Parameters:

instructor_id (str) – The instructor ID to search for

Returns:

The instructor object if found, None otherwise

Return type:

Instructor or None

find_student_by_id(student_id: str)[source]

Find a student by their unique student ID.

Parameters:

student_id (str) – The student ID to search for

Returns:

The student object if found, None otherwise

Return type:

Student or None

load_data(filename: str = 'school_data.json')[source]

Load system data from a JSON file.

Deserializes students, instructors, and courses from a JSON file and reconstructs all object relationships. Replaces current system state.

Parameters:

filename (str, optional) – Path to the input JSON file, defaults to “school_data.json”

Returns:

True if loading was successful, False otherwise

Return type:

bool

remove_course(course_id: str)[source]

Remove a course from the system by ID.

Removes the course and cleans up all student registrations and instructor assignments to maintain system integrity.

Parameters:

course_id (str) – The ID of the course to remove

Returns:

True if course was found and removed, False otherwise

Return type:

bool

remove_instructor(instructor_id: str)[source]

Remove an instructor from the system by ID.

Removes the instructor and unassigns them from all courses to maintain system integrity.

Parameters:

instructor_id (str) – The ID of the instructor to remove

Returns:

True if instructor was found and removed, False otherwise

Return type:

bool

remove_student(student_id: str)[source]

Remove a student from the system by ID.

Removes the student and cleans up all course registrations to maintain system integrity.

Parameters:

student_id (str) – The ID of the student to remove

Returns:

True if student was found and removed, False otherwise

Return type:

bool

save_data(filename: str = 'school_data.json')[source]

Save all system data to a JSON file.

Serializes all students, instructors, and courses to a JSON file for persistent storage. Maintains relationships between objects.

Parameters:

filename (str, optional) – Path to the output JSON file, defaults to “school_data.json”

class school_management.Student(name: str, age: int, email: str, student_id: str)[source]

Bases: Person

Class representing a student in the school management system.

Extends the Person class to include student-specific functionality such as student ID management and course registration tracking.

Parameters:

  • name (str) – The student’s full name

  • age (int) – The student’s age in years

  • email (str) – The student’s email address

  • student_id (str) – Unique identifier for the student

Raises:

ValueError – If any parameter fails validation

Variables:

  • student_id (str) – The student’s unique identifier

  • registered_courses (List[Course]) – List of courses the student is registered for

register_course(course)[source]

Register the student for a course.

Adds the course to the student’s registered courses list and adds the student to the course’s enrolled students list. Prevents duplicate registrations.

Parameters:

course (Course) – The course to register for

to_dict()[source]

Convert student object to dictionary representation.

Creates a dictionary containing all student data including registered course IDs for serialization purposes.

Returns:

Dictionary representation of the student

Return type:

dict
